title: Part a. [0â€“9]
stimulusHtml:
9 points (i. 6 points; ii. 3 points)

i. 6 points

3 points: One point for each arrow drawn in the correct direction

1 point deduction: For not having all arrows approximately the same length

1 point deduction: For not having all arrows start at P1

1 point deduction: For having one or more extra vectors

3 points: One point for each arrow drawn in the correct direction

1 point deduction: For not having lengths of arrows such that EC = EB > EA

1 point deduction: For not having all arrows start at P2

1 point deduction: For having one or more extra vectors

ii. 3 points

3 points: One point for having check mark or other indicator in each correct box

title: Part b. [0â€“1]
stimulusHtml: 1 point: For an indication that the x-components of the field vectors due to particles C and B cancel each other due to the symmetry created by having a vertex of the triangle on the y-axis
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

No point earned.

1 point: For an indication that the x-components of the field vectors due to particles C and B cancel each other due to the symmetry created by having a vertex of the triangle on the y-axis

The student response earns all of the following points:

Earns 1 of 1 point.

1 point: For an indication that the x-components of the field vectors due to particles C and B cancel each other due to the symmetry created by having a vertex of the triangle on the y-axis
